intro: Pouteria coelomatica, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or golden starfruit, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to starfruits but have a distinct flavor and texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its fruit. Pouteria coelomatica is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
